intro: Tribulus cistoides var. medius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed calotropis, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, hard seeds. It is adapted to thrive in poor soils and can withstand drought conditions due to its deep root system.
